metadata.title: USN-6684-1 -- ncurses vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ncurses incorrectly handled certain function return values, possibly leading to segmentation fault. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6684-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libx32ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib32tinfo-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 ncurses-examples - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 ncurses-bin - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib32ncurses5-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib32ncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libtinfo-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib32ncursesw5-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib32tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libtinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib32ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib64tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libncurses5-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib64ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 lib64ncurses5-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libx32ncurses5-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 ncurses-base - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libx32tinfo-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 ncurses-doc - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libx32ncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libx32ncursesw5-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libx32tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 libncursesw5-dev - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 ncurses-term - 6.1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1+esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
